meanings.definition: Pertaining to an age or ages.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins held an aeonic charm.
meanings.sent2: The aeonic traditions of the tribe were passed down for generations.
meanings.sent3: The aeonic trees seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him felt aeonic, never fading with time.
meanings.sent5: The aeonic mountains stood tall, unchanged by the passing years.

meanings.definition: Lasting for an indefinitely long time.
meanings.sent1: The aeonic friendship between the two neighbors was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: The aeonic bond between the siblings was unbreakable.
meanings.sent3: The aeonic rainstorm seemed to never end, flooding the streets.
meanings.sent4: His patience was aeonic, never running out even in the toughest times.
meanings.sent5: The aeonic flame flickered but never extinguished, a symbol of hope.

meanings.definition: Existing or continuing through all time.
meanings.sent1: The aeonic stars shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The aeonic belief in the afterlife gave comfort to many.
meanings.sent3: The aeonic clock in the town square never seemed to move.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was aeonic, eternally lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The aeonic river flowed through the valley, a constant presence.
